ca.uhn.fhir.model.dstu.resource

Class Condition

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uhn.fhir.model.api.BaseElement
      • ca.uhn.fhir.model.api.BaseResource
        • ca.uhn.fhir.model.dstu.resource.Condition
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ICompositeElement, IElement, IResource, ISupportsUndeclaredExtensions

    public class Condition
extends BaseResource
implements IResource
    HAPI/FHIR Condition Resource (Detailed information about conditions, problems or diagnoses)

    Definition: Use to record detailed information about conditions, problems or diagnoses recognized by a clinician. There are many uses including: recording a Diagnosis during an Encounter; populating a problem List or a Summary Statement, such as a Discharge Summary

    Requirements:

    Profile Definition: http://hl7.org/fhir/profiles/Condition

      • getIdentifier

        public List<IdentifierDt> getIdentifier()
        Gets the value(s) for identifier (External Ids for this condition). creating it if it does not exist. Will not return null.

        Definition: This records identifiers associated with this condition that are defined by business processed and/ or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate (e.g. in CDA documents, or in written / printed documentation)

      • getAbatement

        public IDatatype getAbatement()
        Gets the value(s) for abatement[x] (If/when in resolution/remission). creating it if it does not exist. Will not return null.

        Definition: The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called \"abatement\" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with \"remission\" or \"resolution\" - Conditions are never really resolved, but they can abate.

      • setAbatement

        public Condition setAbatement(IDatatype theValue)
        Sets the value(s) for abatement[x] (If/when in resolution/remission)

        Definition: The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called \"abatement\" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with \"remission\" or \"resolution\" - Conditions are never really resolved, but they can abate.

      • getStage

        public Condition.Stage getStage()
        Gets the value(s) for stage (Stage/grade, usually assessed formally). creating it if it does not exist. Will not return null.

        Definition: Clinical stage or grade of a condition. May include formal severity assessments

      • setStage

        public Condition setStage(Condition.Stage theValue)
        Sets the value(s) for stage (Stage/grade, usually assessed formally)

        Definition: Clinical stage or grade of a condition. May include formal severity assessments

        public List<Condition.Location> getLocation()
        Gets the value(s) for location (Anatomical location, if relevant). creating it if it does not exist. Will not return null.

        Definition: The anatomical location where this condition manifests itself

      • setLocation

        Definition: The anatomical location where this condition manifests itself

      • getNotes

        public StringDt getNotes()
        Gets the value(s) for notes (Additional information about the Condition). creating it if it does not exist. Will not return null.
